item.text: Barbara Mazzolai is currently the Coordinator of the Center for Micro-BioRobotics (IIT@SSSA) of the Istituto Italiano di Tecnologia (IIT) of Genoa, Italy - [http://www.iit.it/it/persone/barbara-mazzolai.html iit.it]

Her current scientific research is in the fields of biorobotics and biomimetic robotics, focused on studying and understanding mechanisms, sensors, actuation solutions, and locomotion strategies inspired by Nature. In particular, she is currently investigating soft-bodied animals (e.g. octopus) and vegetal systems from an engineering point of view and with engineering tools, with the aim to design and develop new enabling technologies and robotic solutions, and to better understand the biological working principles and mechanisms. She is the Coordinator of the FET-OPEN PLANTOID Project. Moreover, she has a long experience as Project Manager of European Projects in biorobotics and service robotics.

Her current scientific research is in the fields of biorobotics and biomimetic robotics, focused on studying and understanding mechanisms, sensors, actuation solutions, and locomotion strategies inspired by Nature.

Barbara Mazzolai is currently the Coordinator of the Center for Micro-BioRobotics of the Istituto Italiano di Tecnologia of Genoa, Italy - [http://www.iit.it/it/persone/barbara-mazzolai.html iit.it]

Barbara Mazzolai is currently the coordinator of the [[Plantoid]] Project, and Center for Micro-BioRobotics of the Istituto Italiano di Tecnologia of Genoa, Italy - [http://www.iit.it/it/persone/barbara-mazzolai.html iit.it]
